# both

**Type Property**

An option that displays the animation’s initial frame or final frame when playback occurs outside of the normal duration.

## Declaration

```swift
static let both: AnimationFillMode
```

## Discussion

For example, if you extend a hand-waving animation’s duration by one second in both directions by setting [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/trimStart] to `-1.0`, and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/trimEnd] to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/duration] + `1.0`, a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/fillMode] of `both` determines that the hand holds its initial appearance for one second before continuing to wave. Then, the animation freezes on its final hand-waving frame for one second before disappearing.

## Choosing a fill mode

- **none**: An option that indicates an animation doesn’t display frame data outside of its normal duration.
- **forwards**: An option that freezes the last frame of the animation until it stops.
- **backwards**: An option that shows the first animation frame while playback progresses to the beginning position.
